dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 718 IH: Public Lands in Public Hands Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Zinke (for himself and Mr. Vasquez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To prohibit the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture from transferring certain Federal land, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Public Lands in Public Hands Act.

In this Act, the term publicly accessible tract means a tract of Federal land managed by the Secretary of the Interior or the Chief of the Forest Service that can be accessed by public road, public trail, public waterway, public easement, or public right-of-way.

section.header: Restriction on transfer of certain Federal land

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture are prohibited from transferring title to Federal land to a non-Federal entity, if the Federal land is—

clause.text: is owned by a State, county, or municipal government; and
can be accessed by public road, public trail, public waterway, public easement, or public right-of-way.

subsection.text: Subsection (a) shall not apply to a transfer—

clause.text: less than 5 acres and accessible via a public waterway; and

subparagraph.text: authorized to be transferred under and subject to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976;
the Southern Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998;
Public Law 85–569, commonly known as the Townsites Act of 1958;
the Act of May 17, 1906, commonly known as the Native Allotment Act of 1906;
Public Law 85–508, commonly known as the Alaska Statehood Act of 1959;
the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act;
the Alaska Native Vietnam-era Veterans Land Allotment Program authorized by section 1119 of the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act;
the Recreation and Public Purposes Act; or

paragraph.text: explicitly authorized by Federal law; or
completed through a land exchange authorized by Federal law.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall not subdivide Federal land to meet acreage minimums described in subsection (b)(1).

section.text: Nothing in this Act shall be used to influence or interpret the legality of stepping over a property corner from one parcel of public land to another.
